title: General
fullText:
Each electrical conductor that is part of the electrical system shall have a means to identify its function in the system, except for conductors integral with engines as supplied by their manufacturers, and bonding conductors.
Conductor colour identification shall comply with AS/NZS 3000.
Where colours do not comply with Table 3.4 of AS/NZS 3000, a durable label with cable identification details shall be permanently attached in a prominent position on the front panel of all switchboards.
NOTES:
1	A colour stripe or number may be added to the conductor insulation for identification in the system.
2	Boats with a.c. and d.c. systems should avoid the use of a brown, white or light blue insulation colour in the d.c. system unless clearly separated from the a.c. conductors and identified.
3	See AS/NZS 3000:2007, Clauses 3.8.3.2 and 3.8.3.3.
